chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, and/or counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
-No use or possession of CBD products. 
-No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packages, or distributed.

-Case 21CM1915 is dismissed and read-in. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
filed by Atty. Priya Barnes

Case called at 2:56 PM
Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Priya Barnes in court for William J Davis.  
Defendant William J Davis in court.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, and 6 are dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
SENTENCE IS WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  18 MONTHS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
No use/possession of CBD products
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchases used, stored, packaged, or distributed

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
